text: only on coded templates you can handle that

Shot in the dark here. A client of ours reported that some malicious code was found on a few of their HubSpot pages. The scan is done by <http://sucuri.net|sucuri.net> and the code in question that the scanner found malicious was `<script>var t=new Date;document.getElementById("timestamp").innerHTML=t;</script>` I'm not seeing this code anywhere in the source code or any timestamp ID throughout the site for that matter. This message was also attached: <https://labs.sucuri.net/db/malware/warning.html_anomaly?2> Has anyone experienced an issue like this before with a HubSpot site?
never seen that before but sounds like a javascript file likely was rendering that script element  and whoever wrote it some how placed that script element outside of the html element
the code itself doesn’t look malicious to me
pretty scary code right there :slightly_smiling_face:
indeed. some would even say, malicious.
<https://gph.is/2JwKpTz>
Just so you know it is currently Thu Jun 20 2019 14:10:53 GMT-0500 (Central Daylight Time)
in-case you feel like infecting your computer with the sheer concept of time <https://codepen.io/thewebtech/pen/bPgvyx?editors=1111>
sorry forgot to put my words of warning on there “Do not run on the last day of the year 1999. The world could end, or maybe nothing will happen, I wouldn’t take the chance.”
Bwahahaha
there. updated
i think were safe to say its not malicious. thanks for you help, guys!
made my day a little more enjoyable thank you for sharing it Tony

Hey all! New to HubSpot, trying to figure out how to plug JS files into custom HTML/HubL templates. I have a template that isn't loading a JS file by public URL. So the following code in my footer doesn't load: ```
    <script src="{{ get_public_template_url('Dashboard/assets/js/dashboard-topnav.js') }}"></script>
```
However, if I copy-paste the JS as an inline tag in the exact same location, it works fine. Any ideas on why it's not taking the public URL as a script src, but works fine as inline script? Thanks for your time!
(Let me know if I should ask this in another channel, too.)
It's recommended to use the `require_js` function: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/en/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-functions#require-js>
that should help you get it correctly wihtout have to worry about script tags or anything like that
for your example it would be `{{ require_js("Dashboard/assets/js/dashboard-topnav.js") }}`
that would place it in the footer by default
Awesome, thanks <@U2H3TT8F2>!
This is likely from one of the error pages. The tool probably tripped one of the security filters.
